Braces don't work on every curve. Bracing won't help if a curve is too big (usually more than 40 degrees). And a brace may not be needed if a curve is too small

Wearing a brace is often the first step for kids who need treatment for idiopathic scoliosis. Doctors prescribe a brace hoping it will stop the curve from getting worse and help kids avoid spinal fusion surgery.Braces don't work on every curve. Bracing won't help if a curve is too big (usually more than 40 degrees). And a brace may not be needed if a curve is too small

If your curve is greater than 45 to 50 degrees, it will very likely get worse, even after you are fully grown. This may increase the cosmetic deformity in your back, as well as affect your lung function. Surgery is recommended.
